column4: Hey all. Was getting tips earlier to getting wifi working on my laptop. Closer to solved now (lspci sees wifi hw) but still not in ifconfig
try ifconfig -a
that shows all of the network interfaces, even disabled ones.
even with the -a option?
you been here: https://help.ubuntu.com/community/WifiDocs/Device/Broadcom_BCM4311_rev_01_(ndiswrapper) yet?
that uses a windows driver in ndiswrapper, but it should work if your prepared to be a little hacky
can you give the output of "lspci -vvnn | grep 14e4"
great
does the correct broadcom driver appear in "additional drivers" (under system settings pane)
oh, ok then
when you said that youd already seen it, did you mean the link I sent you?
ok
so try this: "sudo apt-get install bcmwl-kernel-source"
scratch that, that won't work
on second thought... run that command
tell me when you've done that
ok
now run: "sudo modprobe -r b43 ssb wl"
that's OK, now run this: sudo modprobe wl"
